description: Head for the dark side of the City and discover tales of crime and punishment, heroes and villains, the great monastic houses, notorious Newgate Prison, body snatchers, Smithfield Market, Bartholomew Fair and the road to the gallows.

events.name: Order and Disorder: Guildhall to Smithfield
Order and Disorder: Guildhall to Smithfield

factsheet.heading: Guildhall
paragraphs: A rare medieval gem at the epicentre of Order in the City of London

factsheet.heading: Wood Street: Policing the City
paragraphs: How keeping the peace in the past was such a hit and miss affair - and why the City of London has its very own police force.

factsheet.heading: Postman's Park
paragraphs: The deadly epidemic that led to the creation of one of the City's best loved pocket parks.

factsheet.heading: Christchurch Greyfriars
paragraphs: The rags to riches to rags story of one of the City's great monastic houses.

factsheet.heading: Cutler's Hall
paragraphs: The fascinating story of the City's great livery companies.

factsheet.heading: Old Bailey
paragraphs: The story of notorious Newgate prison and its most celebrated inmate  - the 18th century escapologist Jack Sheppard.

factsheet.heading: St Sepulchre without Newgate
paragraphs: How the parish church across the road from Newgate prison played its part on the road to the gallows.

factsheet.heading: Giltspur Street Watchhouse
paragraphs: On the look out for body snatchers!

factsheet.heading: Pye Corner
paragraphs: The Golden Boy marks the spot Where the Great Fire of London ended in 1666 , and where The Fortune of War Public House  once stood -  haunt of the so called Resurrectionists.

factsheet.heading: St Bartholomew's Hospital
paragraphs: Founded in 1123 by Rahere - re-founded by Henry VIII  - this hospital has provided almost 900 years of continuous care on its original site.

factsheet.heading: The Smithfield Martyrs
paragraphs: Hear the tragic stories of those  burned at the stake here for their beliefs.

factsheet.heading: St Bartholomew The Great
paragraphs: The story of  a great survivor;  why the Priory suppressed by Henry VIII still thrives today, revered for its monastic atmosphere.

factsheet.heading: Bartholomew Fair
paragraphs: Find out how a medieval trade show descended over the centuries into chaotic disorder and met its inevitable end.

factsheet.heading: Smithfield Market
paragraphs: The story of the great market that has existed here for 1000 years -  and what next for the site, as the market prepares to move on to pastures new.

location.address: Gresham Street, City of London, EC2V

name: Order and Disorder: Guildhall to Smithfield
